reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game was broken unplayable, after trying to contact support and doing every possible trick I could possibly try, going into the forums and reading pages after pages of possible solutions, I gave up and requested a refund. I couldn't even get the game to start. Here are my specs:

System Model: G750JM
BIOS: G750JM.206
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4710HQ CPU @ 2.50GHz (8 CPUs), ~2.5GHz
Memory: 8192MB RAM
Available OS Memory: 8074MB RAM
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 860M
Display Memory: 4020 MB
Dedicated Memory: 1972 MB
Shared Memory: 2048 MB
Intel(R) HD Graphics 4600
Manufacturer: Intel Corporation
Chip type: Intel(R) HD Graphics Family
DAC type: Internal

I blow past the minimum requirements, but the problem seems to be a conflict with my internal intel graphics. Internal graphics lowers my energy consumption when Im not playing games, which i require as a truck driver, but even after disabling it I could not load the game, or get enough help from support. Most games I can set the settings in nvidia to automatically switch to nvidia card or to internal intel. But this game does not get detected and setting it manually in nvidia does not do anything because the game will still try loading on the internal graphics regardless if you force load the nvidia card while the game plays. And disabling the intel graphics just mean you get new problems loading. It looked like it tried loading on a graphics card that does not exist, and removing and reinstalling does not work. Then I just gave up.

Early Access Review

--Revised.--

It's honestly not worth it. Wait a year or two, maybe three.

Pros:

-stable for an alpha build
-If you get enough people to yell at the dev team, they'll do something sensible

Cons:

-incredibly unfriendly community
-virtually no large MP servers
-trash dev team; the few that actually get around to talking with their community are startlingly egotistical and manage to have no knowledge of the game even though they're the ones making it
-has been in alpha since mid 2012, no signs of changing any time soon

Overall quality: 6/10
Content: 3/10
Replayability: 6/10
Building: 5/10
Learning curve: 0/10

Recommend? : No.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update: I got it running on my Nvidia GPU laptop.  I verified local files and then it ran.  I'm still not recommending the game at this time but at least I can play it.

Won't start on two different computers, one dedicated Nvidia GPU and other is Intel.  I figured the Intel one might not work but I can't get this started on anything.  Terrible experience.  I'd get my money back but it was bought in the Humble Bundle.  I was excited to play this, but I've really enjoyed Reassembly so the bundle was worth it.

Oh, and by the way I have Java on both computers.  The Intel one actually gets closer to loading, but crashes.  And I'd say the 1.0+ hrs on record it shows is me trying to launch the game because it uses a launcher.

The developer needs to stop what they are doing and write some exception handling during startup that at minimum tells the user why the game didn't start.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game gets boring quite quick. I would expect that a space sim should be made for exploration but the slow speed does not help with that. You also have no ingame mechanism for speeding up your ship except for the jump drives. You have to resort to hacking the config files. Would have liked it if I could rather add more thrusters to gain speed or at least build different kinds of thrusters. You are in constant search for the right kind of minerals if you want to make anything advance. You cannot place factories on your ship which means if you wanted to explore and get equipment at the same time then you're screwed. I cannot recommend this game to anyone. Rather play minecraft.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There is a lot of good to be said about the game, especially that the demo essentially allows players to play for free, but it feels like that is  only there because of how broken this game truly is. I am writing this post on 12/20/2015 and the game was launched over a year ago via Early Access on 11/27/2014. Over a year later and the core mechanics of this game are still completely and utterly unstable.

Java simply can’t run everything these developers want to do. Beefed out servers hold and run a nice small set of players mining and building, but as soon as it is time for anything more than that get ready to have even the most technologically sophisticated servers buckle under the pressure. My group’s latest attempt to get back into this game netted us server crashes and pings in excess of4k - 10k for one player simply attacking a Pirate station.  Not some sort of galactic struggle for dominance, but a simple PvE interaction between one player.

I’d love to spend a hefty amount of time here to write more, but it just doesn’t feel worth my time. The developers seem to still be making updates, but are focusing on non-critical items to this game such as the problem mentioned above. This game would be quite a bit of fun if the core mechanics worked properly and it is a darn shame that they don’t.
